address: Xã Nghi Hưng, Huyện Nghi Lộc, Tỉnh Nghệ An
thought:
**Mapping the Old Vietnamese Address to the New Administrative Structure**

Okay, so I've got a Vietnamese address to translate, specifically mapping the old wards to their new counterparts based on these resolutions and ward data. Let's see...

First, I need to pinpoint the province. Ah, "Tỉnh Nghệ An" – got it. Now, the crucial step is to see if any resolutions altered this. I'll check the relevant documents. Resolution 60-NQ/TW doesn't show any changes, so "Tỉnh Nghệ An" is good to go, it's still "Tỉnh Nghệ An".

Next, I need to identify the old ward within this province. It's "Xã Nghi Hưng." Now, the fun part: I have to meticulously scan the "Other Resolutions" for any mentions of this ward. And there it is, Resolution 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15. Bingo! Line 53. It clearly states that "Xã Nghi Hưng" is being merged with "Xã Nghi Đồng" and "Xã Nghi Phương" to form a new ward called "**Xã Thần Lĩnh**."

Excellent. With that information, I'll consult the "New wards" data. I'll search for "Xã Thần Lĩnh" specifically within "Tỉnh Nghệ An." Found it! I have the data: `{"ward_code":"17842","ward_name":"Xã Thần Lĩnh","province_name":"Tỉnh Nghệ An"}`.

The confidence here is very high. The resolution is explicit about the merger of "Xã Nghi Hưng" into "Xã Thần Lĩnh," and the province remains the same. The data is clear.

Now, I will construct the final JSON output, based on the provided schema, with high confidence in the accuracy of my mapping. This process has been streamlined and I'm confident of the result.

citation.header: 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Nghệ An
citation.line: 53. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Nghi Đồng, Nghi Hưng và Nghi Phương thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Thần Lĩnh.
